title: The Protected
opening: King Hayden apologizes for being unable to spare soldiers. However, he does provide Eirika with a small but trusted party of vassals. Eirika is grateful for the king’s aid. Chasing rumors of her brother, she sets out for Grado. The group’s first stop is the remote village of Ide, which was, until very recently, a part of Renais. Here, Eirika sees the devastation of Renais with her own eyes.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Seth has mapped out a route for us. We’ll travel south of Renais and pass through Serafew into Grado territory.

intro.speaker: Moulder
intro.line: Hmm... That would seem a sensible plan. Assuming, of course, that we can avoid any run-ins with Grado soldiers...

intro.speaker: Vanessa
intro.line: Princess Eirika, may I have your leave to scout ahead? From the sky, I’ll have a better chance of spotting any nearby troops.

intro.speaker: Moulder
intro.line: We’re yours to command, Your Highness. Will you give your permission?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Yes, of course. Keep an eye out for enemy bowmen though, Vanessa.

intro.speaker: Vanessa
intro.line: Yes, Your Highness, I shall. I shall prove myself worthy of the honor of your trust.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: She seems very...sincere.

intro.speaker: Moulder
intro.line: Sincere...Yes, quite.

intro.speaker: Bone
intro.line: Hey, boss! We’ve found more villages ripe for the picking.

intro.speaker: Bazba
intro.line: One, two, three... Ha ha ha! I love a good war! With all those soldiers preoccupied, we’re free to pillage as we please! Right, Bone–you’re in charge. Grab everything that’s not nailed down and bring it to the hideout.

intro.speaker: Bone
intro.line: I’m on it.

intro.speaker: Ross
intro.line: Dad! Bandits approaching!

intro.speaker: Garcia
intro.line: Hmmm... I’m getting you out of here, Ross. You stay close to me!

intro.speaker: Bone
intro.line: Let’s start with that village there! Go to it, boys! It’s all yours. Cut down anyone fool enough to get in your way. I’m heading west around the mountains to the other villages.

intro.speaker: Ross
intro.line: Unnnng!

intro.speaker: Garcia
intro.line: Ross? What is it? What’s wrong?

intro.speaker: Ross
intro.line: It’s nothing! It’s just a scratch! You’re a warrior, Dad, and I am your son. I won’t be beaten so easily.

intro.speaker: Garcia
intro.line: Don’t risk yourself so foolishly... We need to get you some help. Please! Someone help my son!

intro.speaker: Vanessa
intro.line: Ah! This looks serious. I must report back to Princess Eirika at once.

intro.speaker: Vanessa
intro.line: I have bad news. The village to the east is under attack by bandits.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Bandits?!

intro.speaker: Moulder
intro.line: We have arrived at our first dilemma. We must move quickly and attract as little attention as possible, but...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: But I cannot stand by and watch innocents be harmed. Vanessa, how fare the villagers?

intro.speaker: Vanessa
intro.line: I spotted one injured person. He appeared to be just a child.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Father Moulder, can your staff help him?

intro.speaker: Moulder
intro.line: Well, yes, I can heal his injuries with my staff, but... I cannot do it from here. He’s too far away. I must be near him.

intro.speaker: Vanessa
intro.line: Princess, please leave this to me. I shall bring the boy here.

intro.speaker: Moulder
intro.line: All right, Vanessa. It’s up to you.

intro.speaker: Vanessa
intro.line: Very well. I’m off.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Hm? What is it? What’s all the ruckus? What? B-bandits?! Spread the word, everyone! Close the village gates! Thank you for your warning. Please, accept this small token.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: This is terrible...What are we going to do? The Bandits are so close. If we can’t find some way to protect ourselves, the village is doomed.

visit.speaker: Eirika
visit.line: People, listen to me! You must close the village gates immediately. Hurry, before the bandits arrive!

visit.speaker: Selena
visit.line: Who are you? You aren’t from one of the neighboring towns, are you. And your weapons give you away... You’re no peasant.

visit.speaker: Eirika
visit.line: I am Er... My name is Erina. I’m a mercenary.

visit.speaker: Selena
visit.line: A mercenary named Erina, is it? There’s more to you than that, I feel. But don’t worry–it’s none of my affair. I haven’t told you who I am yet, have I? I am Selena, a general in Grado’s army.

visit.speaker: Selena
visit.line: It looks like these villagers have some bandit troubles. I would like to help, but I have orders... I’m to leave for the capital immediately, and I cannot stay. You’re armed, and you claim to be a mercenary. Will you help them?

visit.speaker: Eirika
visit.line: No! Of course I’ll help them! It’s just...You’re one of Grados’ generals...Why...

visit.speaker: Selena
visit.line: These aren’t soldiers. They’re people. Should they suffer because their leaders fight? I’ve petitioned your aid. Take this as payment.

visit.speaker: Selena
visit.line: And who are you? You don’t look like one of the local peasantry. As you can see, the villagers have some bandit troubles. I would like to help, but I have orders to follow... I am required to quit this area at once. I would ask you to aid them in this fight. I will pay you for your trouble, of course.

visit.speaker: Young Lady
visit.line: The most wonderful man rescued me. He was dressed like a mercenary, but he had an air of elegance about him... He gave me this elixir. I’m sure it will help you on the battlefield.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ross
recruit-talk.line: Hey, listen! My village is being attacked by bandits. My name’s Ross. Come on! You have to help me wipe those thugs out!

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: All right, just... Just take a deep breath and calm down, Ross. Leave the villages to us. We’ll drive off the bandits. Seth, take the boy somewhere safe.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ross
recruit-talk.line: No! Wait! I’m going to fight, too!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ross
recruit-talk.line: My father is out there all alone, fighting those bandits. I’ve got to get back to him as quickly as possible! I’m the son of the great Garcia! As long as I have my axe, no bandit will ever defeat me!

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: All right, I can see you’re not going to be swayed... But you must promise that you will stay close to us.

recruit-talk.speaker: Garcia
recruit-talk.line: Ross?! Boy, what did I tell you!? What are you doing here? Don’t worry about me. Hurry up and get yourself to safety!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ross
recruit-talk.line: Did you really think I could just run away while you fight, Dad? You taught me that fighters fight for what’s important to them! There’s no way I’m leaving! I’m fighting just like you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Garcia
recruit-talk.line: Ross... All right, listen to me. We’ll cut our way out of here together!

boss.speaker: Bone
boss.line: Wait a minute! Wh-who are you?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Y-yes... Someone bumped into me is all. I was jarred.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Hm? Your Highness, where is your bracelet?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: My bracelet? It’s...gone. Where could it be? Did that man–

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Don’t worry about it, Seth. That bracelet was a gift from my father, but Ephraim needs our help. I can’t let sentimentality get in the way of my duty.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: No, Princess... We must retrieve your bracelet regardless of cost. You cannot lose it. Let’s go. We must hurry.

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: It’s time to start. Are you ready, Eirika?

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: Tell me, though: why do you want me to teach you to fight? I thought you didn’t care for violence...

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: I do not like uncivilized behavior. I think one can solve one’s problems without fighting. And yet...

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: I’ve always relied on you to protect me, Brother. I would rather not be such a burden to you in the future. So, I thought maybe I should learn to protect myself...

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: I’m your brother. Brothers are supposed to protect their sisters. It’s nothing for you to worry about. It’s no cause for concern.

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: Yes, but... I am your sister. Sisters are supposed to worry about their brothers. So I would like to learn something of swordplay, if only a little. And maybe, someday, I can protect you in your time of need... So please, Ephraim.

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: All right, all right. How could I say no? Honestly, once you get an idea into your head, that’s it. I might as well give in. It’s agreed. I’ll teach you, but won’t hold back because you’re my sister. And I want no complaining once we’ve started, Eirika.
